metadata.title: First steps for working with AdSDK

sections.title: First steps for working with AdSDK
sections.chapter: Working with the built-in capabilities of the SDK

inlineContent.text: This tutorial will guide you the first steps for working with the
which has already implemented all steps from this tutorial.
Also, make sure that the project is configured to work with the Swift 6.
Let’s create a new IOS project and connect the
for it, with the state of the application:
. We will use it for future configuration of our app.
The only mandatory parameter when creating
. Network ID is the ID of your advertising account.
The entry point into the SDK is the
class. This is the first thing we should create, as it will be used to generate advertisements in the future. To do this, import
, then add the initialization code for the
The SDK supports only one type of error -
. Since we just want to display errors to the user, create
, we can pass it to the user for display.
Now, if you’ve done everything right, you should see the “Ready” message when you launch the app. This completes the
for the subsequent creation and loading of advertisements.

abstract.text: This tutorial will guide you how to create and display inline ads. An inline ad is an ad created to be displayed in your view hierarchy.
Sometimes you need to handle taps in your own way. For example, to display ads in the internal browser in the app. In this tutorial, we will learn how to customise the SDK’s tap handling behaviour.
Describes a request to load an advertisement.
This tutorial will guide you how to create and display inline ads. An inline ad is an ad created to be displayed in your view hierarchy.
A full-screen advertisement that fills the host app’s interface is known as an interstitial ad. In this tutorial we are going to add interstitial ad into our application.

doc://com.adsdk.core/tutorials/AdSDKCore.title: Registering a renderer in the SDK

abstract.text: In this tutorial, we will learn how to create custom ads using AdSDK. This process is the same for both inline and interstitial ads.
Sometimes you need to handle taps in your own way. For example, to display ads in the internal browser in the app. In this tutorial, we will learn how to customise the SDK’s tap handling behaviour.

abstract.text: A key object for configuring your advertisements.

The SDK supports a persistent cache with resources related to ad, these can be banners or other resources, depending on the type of ad. In this tutorial, we’ll look at how an application developer can control the cache.

abstract.text: Manage, display, and create your custom advertisements on iOS using cutting-edge technologies such as Structured Concurrency, and SwiftUI.
This tutorial will guide you how to create and display inline ads. An inline ad is an ad created to be displayed in your view hierarchy.
The unique identifier of the ad network.
We already know how to create and perform
, and

. However, each of them can have additional parameters, which are called global parameters because they are specified globally for all requests. The SDK provides the ability to add global parameters once so that you don’t have to copy them when creating each request.

The SDK supports a persistent cache with resources related to ad, these can be banners or other resources, depending on the type of ad. In this tutorial, we’ll look at how an application developer can control the cache.
